intro: Brachystegia bournei, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and bipinnate leaves. The tree produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fibrous aril. It is often found in dry, open woodlands and is adapted to seasonal climates with distinct wet and dry periods. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
